title: Who Can Own Property in the UK?

section1.heading: Who Can Own Property in the UK?
content: The good news for international buyers is that the UK offers a relatively open property market.
UK Citizens and Residents: British citizens and those with permanent residency in the UK have full rights to purchase any type of property, freehold or leasehold (more on these terms later).
Non-Residents: Non-residents can also freely purchase property in the UK. There are no restrictions on nationality, and the buying process is generally straightforward.

section2.heading: Additional Considerations
content: Tax implications: Non-residents may be subject to additional taxes, such as Capital Gains Tax (CGT) or Annual Tax on Enveloped Dwellings (ATED), depending on the property type and their residency status.
Financing options: Obtaining a mortgage as a non-resident might be more challenging compared to UK residents.

section3.heading: Benefits of Owning Property in the UK
content: Stable Economy and Political Environment: The UK boasts a stable economy with a track record of steady property price growth in most areas.
Diverse Property Market: The UK offers a wide variety of properties, from luxury apartments in London to historic cottages in the countryside, catering to various budgets and lifestyles.
Strong Legal System: The UK has a well-established and secure legal system, providing property owners with peace of mind.
Education System: The UK's world-renowned education system attracts families seeking quality education for their children.
